result.execSummary:
The defendant Roman L Santiago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. (at a rate of $50.00/month commenc 10/1/15)

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.
Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug/urine screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol/illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Not to use or possess of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Sign medical release for Agent.
Within 60 days become involved in a 12 step program and obtain a sponsor/mentor.
Obtain a valid driver's license within 6 months.
Operate a MV with a valid driver's license.
No contact with Home Depot, Wal-Mart, Target, Christie K., Mark B., Hector C. Jr., Corianna G. and Todd E.
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided and pay surcharge.

Cases 13CM1280, 13CM1777, 13CM2027, and 13CM2046 were dismissed and read into: 13CF1317, 13CF1535 and 14CF160.
